All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, ptolemy.actor.Actor, ptolemy.actor.Executable, ptolemy.actor.FiringsRecordable, ptolemy.actor.Initializable, ptolemy.actor.TimedActor, ptolemy.actor.TypedActor, ptolemy.kernel.util.Changeable, ptolemy.kernel.util.Debuggable, ptolemy.kernel.util.DebugListener, ptolemy.kernel.util.Derivable, ptolemy.kernel.util.Instantiable, ptolemy.kernel.util.ModelErrorHandler, ptolemy.kernel.util.MoMLExportable, ptolemy.kernel.util.Moveable, ptolemy.kernel.util.Nameable
public class TriggeredClock
extends Clock
This actor is an extension of Clock with a start and stop input. A token at the start input will start the clock. A token at the stop input will stop the clock, if it is still running. If both start and stop are received simultaneously, then the clock will be stopped.

So that this start and stop ports can be used meaningfully in the CT domain, they are declared DISCRETE, and they should be connected to an event generator. Other domains ignore this declaration.

Since:
Ptolemy II 0.3
Version:
$Id: TriggeredClock.java 57040 2010-01-27 20:52:32Z cxh $
Author:
Edward A. Lee

      public ptolemy.actor.TypedIOPort start
      A port that, if connected, is used to specify when the clock starts. This port has undeclared type.

    • stop

      public ptolemy.actor.TypedIOPort stop
      A port that, if connected, is used to specify when the clock stops. This port has undeclared type.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize() throws ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException
      Override the base class to start not being enabled.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface ptolemy.actor.Initializable
      Overrides:
      initialize in class Clock
      Throws:
      ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException - If the parent class throws it, or if the values parameter is not a row vector, or if the fireAt() method of the director throws it, or if the director does not agree to fire the actor at the specified time.

    • _updateTentativeValues

      protected void _updateTentativeValues() throws ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException
      Copy values committed in initialize() or in the last postfire() into the corresponding tentative variables. In effect, this loads the last known good value for these variables, which is particularly important if time has gone backwards. This overrides the base class to check whether the start or stop inputs have values.
      Overrides:
      _updateTentativeValues in class Clock
      Throws:
      ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException - If thrown accessing start or stop input data.
